Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else.

Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars
Quote: Some people don't understand the promises they're making when they make them,"I said."Right, of course. But you keep the promise anyway. That's what love is. Love is keeping the promise anyway.

Author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
Quote: Someday, after mastering the winds, the waves, the tides and gravity, we shall harness for God the energies of love, and then, for a second time in the history of the world, man will have discovered fire.

Author: J.M. Barrie,  Peter Pan
Quote: All the world is made of faith, and trust, and pixie dust.

Author: John Lennon
Quote: I believe in everything until it's disproved. So I believe in fairies, the myths, dragons. It all exists, even if it's in your mind. Who's to say that dreams and nightmares aren't as real as the here and now?

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Fellowship of the Ring
Quote: Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.

Author: Jon Katz
Quote: I think if I've learned anything about friendship, it's to hang in, stay connected, fight for them, and let them fight for you. Don't walk away, don't be distracted, don't be too busy or tired, don't take them for granted. Friends are part of the glue that holds life and faith together. Powerful stuff.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  Marginalia
Quote: I have great faith in fools - self-confidence my friends will call it.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love.

Author: Elbert Hubbard
Quote: God will not look you over for medals, degrees or diplomas but for scars.

Author: Hāfez
Quote: And still, after all this time,The sun never says to the earth,"You owe Me."Look what happens withA love like that,It lights the Whole Sky.

Author: Corrie ten Boom
Quote: Never be afraid to trust an unknown future to a known God.

Author: Lauren Kate,  Torment
Quote: Sometimes beautiful things come into our lives out of nowhere. We can't always understand them, but we have to trust in them. I know you want to question everything, but sometimes it pays to just have a little faith.

Author: Søren Kierkegaard
Quote: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.

Author: Max Lucado,  He Still Moves Stones
Quote: Faith is not the belief that God will do what you want. It is the belief that God will do what is right.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is like an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.

Author: Greg Behrendt
Quote: I'm about to make a wild, extreme and severe relationship rule: the word busy is a load of crap and is most often used by assholes. The word "busy"is the relationship Weapon of Mass Destruction. It seems like a good excuse, but in fact in every silo you uncover, all you're going to find is a man who didn't care enough to call. Remember men are never to busy to get what they want.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Brida
Quote: None of us knows what might happen even the next minute, yet still we go forward. Because we trust. Because we have Faith.

Author: Dante Alighieri,  Inferno
Quote: Do not be afraid; our fateCannot be taken from us; it is a gift.

Author: Joni Eareckson Tada,  The God I Love
Quote: Sometimes God allows what he hates to accomplish what he loves.

Author: Sylvia Plath
Quote: I talk to God but the sky is empty.

Author: J.M. Barrie,  The Little White Bird
Quote: The reason birds can fly and we can't is simply because they have perfect faith, for to have faith is to have wings.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: I know now, Lord, why you utter no answer. You are yourself the answer. Before your face questions die away. What other answer would suffice?

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: Death is no more than passing from one room into another. But there's a difference for me, you know. Because in that other room I shall be able to see.

Author: Nelson Mandela,  Long Walk to Freedom: Autobiography of Nelson Mandela
Quote: I am fundamentally an optimist. Whether that comes from nature or nurture, I cannot say. Part of being optimistic is keeping one's head pointed toward the sun, one's feet moving forward. There were many dark moments when my faith in humanity was sorely tested, but I would not and could not give myself up to despair. That way lays defeat and death.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: A casual stroll through the lunatic asylum shows that faith does not prove anything.

Author: Marilynne Robinson,  Home
Quote: There's so much to be grateful for, words are poor things.

Author: William Ellery Channing
Quote: Faith is love taking the form of aspiration.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Letters to a Young Poet
Quote: Believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it.

Author: Richelle Mead,  Last Sacrifice
Quote: What was love, really? Flowers, chocolate, and poetry? Or was it something else? Was it being able to finish someone's jokes? Was it having absolute faith that someone was there at your back? Was it knowing someone so well that they instantly understood why you did the things you did—and shared those same beliefs?

Author: Libba Bray
Quote: You can never really know someone completely. That’s why it’s the most terrifying thing in the world, really—taking someone on faith, hoping they’ll take you on faith too. It’s such a precarious balance, It’s a wonder we do it at all. And yet..

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  A Walk to Remember
Quote: I dont think that we're meant to understand it all the time. I think that sometimes we just have to have faith.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Return of the King
Quote: In this hour, I do not believe that any darkness will endure.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: Doubt everything. Find your own light.

Author: Corrie ten Boom,  The Hiding Place
Quote: This is what the past is for! Every experience God gives us, every person He puts in our lives is the perfect preparation for the future that only He can see.

Author: William James
Quote: Belief creates the actual fact.

Author: Carl Sagan
Quote: Extraordinary claims require extraordinary evidence.

Author: Charles M. Schulz
Quote: Are you upset little friend? Have you been lying awake worrying? Well, don't worry...I'm here. The flood waters will recede, the famine will end, the sun will shine tomorrow, and I will always be here to take care of you.

Author: Lisa Wingate
Quote: Your children are the greatest gift God will give to you, and their souls the heaviest responsibility He will place in your hands. Take time with them, teach them to have faith in God. Be a person in whom they can have faith. When you are old, nothing else you've done will have mattered as much.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: There are no coincidences in life. What person that wandered in and out of your life was there for some purpose, even if they caused you harm. Sometimes, it doesn’t make sense the short periods of time we get with people, or the outcomes from their choices. However, if you turn it over to God he promises that you will see the big picture in the hereafter. Nothing is too small to be a mistake.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Second Glance
Quote: Love meant jumping off a cliff and trusting that a certain person would be there to catch you at the bottom.

Author: Robert Anton Wilson,  Cosmic Trigger: Die letzten Geheimnisse der Illuminaten oder An den Grenzen des erweiterten Bewusstseins
Quote: belief is the death of intelligence.

Author: Thomas Merton
Quote: You do not need to know precisely what is happening, or exactly where it is all going. What you need is to recognize the possibilities and challenges offered by the present moment, and to embrace them with courage, faith and hope.

Author: Greg Behrendt,  He's Just Not That Into You: The No-Excuses Truth to Understanding Guys
Quote: You picked a lemon, throw it away lemonade is overrated. Freaks should remain at the circus, not in your apartment. You already have one asshole. You don’t need another. Make a space in your life for the glorious things you deserve. Have faith.

Author: Mitch Albom,  Have a Little Faith: a True Story
Quote: Faith is about doing. You are how you act, not just how you believe.

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: To love means loving the unlovable. To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable. Faith means believing the unbelievable. Hope means hoping when everything seems hopeless.

Author: Joseph Campbell
Quote: Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors for you where there were only walls.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: I have been driven many times upon my knees by the overwhelming conviction that I had no where else to go. My own wisdom and that of all about me seemed insufficient for that day.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle
Quote: Some things have to be believed to be seen.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert
Quote: Faith is walking face-first and full-speed into the dark. If we truly knew all the answers in advance as to the meaning of life and the nature of God and the destiny of our souls, our belief would not be a leap of faith and it would not be a courageous act of humanity; it would just be... a prudent insurance policy.

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: The Simple PathSilence is PrayerPrayer is FaithFaith is LoveLove is ServiceThe Fruit of Service is Peace

Author: Edward Teller
Quote: When you get to the end of all the light you know and it's time to step into the darkness of the unknown, faith is knowing that one of two things shall happen: either you will be given something solid to stand on, or you will be taught how to fly.

Author: Martin Luther
Quote: We are saved by faith alone, but the faith that saves is never alone.

Author: Goldie Hawn
Quote: If we can just let go and trust that things will work out they way they're supposed to, without trying to control the outcome, then we can begin to enjoy the moment more fully. The joy of the freedom it brings becomes more pleasurable than the experience itself.

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: Work without love is slavery.

Author: Rob Bell,  Velvet Elvis: Repainting the Christian Faith
Quote: The moment God is figured out with nice neat lines and definitions, we are no longer dealing with God.

Author: Alan W. Watts
Quote: To have faith is to trust yourself to the water. When you swim you don't grab hold of the water, because if you do you will sink and drown. Instead you relax, and float.

Author: Jocelyn Soriano,  Mend My Broken Heart
Quote: To be rejected by someone doesn't mean you should also reject yourself or that you should think of yourself as a lesser person. It doesn't mean that nobody will ever love you anymore. Remember that only ONE person has rejected you at the moment, and it only hurt so much because to you, that person's opinion symbolized the opinion of the whole world, of God.

Author: R.A. Salvatore,  Streams of Silver
Quote: No, I would not want to live in a world without dragons, as I would not want to live in a world without magic, for that is a world without mystery, and that is a world without faith.

Author: Rick Warren
Quote: You were made by God and for God and until you understand that, life will never make sense.

Author: Beatrix Potter
Quote: Believe there is a great power silently working all things for good, behave yourself and never mind the rest.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: I believe in intuitions and inspirations...I sometimes FEEL that I am right. I do not KNOW that I am.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: Reputation is what others think of us; character is what God knows of us. When you have spent what feels like eternity trying to repair a few moments of time that destroyed the view others once had of you then you must ask yourself if you have the problem or is it really them? God doesn’t make us try so hard, only enemies do.

Author: Dan Brown,  The Da Vinci Code
Quote: Faith ― acceptance of which we imagine to be true, that which we cannot prove.

Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Quote: As a well spent day brings happy sleep, so life well used brings happy death.

Author: Dan Brown,  Angels & Demons
Quote: Faith is universal. Our specific methods for understanding it are arbitrary. Some of us pray to Jesus, some of us go to Mecca, some of us study subatomic particles. In the end we are all just searching for truth, that which is greater than ourselves.

Author: Voltaire,  The Works: Voltaire
Quote: Faith consists in believing what reason cannot.

Author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of Green Gables
Quote: Why must people kneel down to pray? If I really wanted to pray I’ll tell you what I'd do. I'd go out into a great big field all alone or in the deep, deep woods and I'd look up into the sky—up—up—up—into that lovely blue sky that looks as if there was no end to its blueness. And then I'd just feel a prayer.

Author: Pittacus Lore,  I Am Number Four
Quote: No. Don't give up hope just yet. It's the last thing to go. When you have lost hope, you have lost everything. And when you think all is lost, when all is dire and bleak, there is always hope.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: You can't know, you can only believe - or not.

Author: Rabindranath Tagore
Quote: Faith is the bird that feels the light and sings when the dawn is still dark.

Author: Helen Steiner Rice
Quote: When you are in troubled and worried and sick at heartAnd your plans are upset and your world falls apart,Remember God's ready and waiting to shareThe burden you find much to heavy to bear--So with faith, "Let Go and Let GOD"lead your wayInto a brighter and less troubled day

Author: Paul Tillich
Quote: Doubt isn't the opposite of faith; it is an element of faith.

Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass
Quote: Dance. Smile. Giggle. Marvel. TRUST. HOPE. LOVE. WISH. BELIEVE. Most of all, enjoy every moment of the journey, and appreciate where you are at this moment instead of always focusing on how far you have to go.

Author: Roopleen
Quote: If you have a dream, don’t just sit there. Gather courage to believe that you can succeed and leave no stone unturned to make it a reality.

Author: Ezra Taft Benson
Quote: The Lord works from the inside out. The world works from the outside in. The world would take people out of the slums. Christ would take the slums out of people, and then they would take themselves out of the slums.The world would mold men by changing their environment. Christ changes men, who then change their environment. The world would shape human behavior, but Christ can change human nature.

Author: William Shakespeare,  A Midsummer Night's Dream
Quote: My soul is in the sky.

Author: Roger A. Caras
Quote: Dogs have given us their absolute all. We are the center of their universe. We are the focus of their love and faith and trust. They serve us in return for scraps. It is without a doubt the best deal man has ever made.

Author: Brennan Manning,  Abba's Child: The Cry of the Heart for Intimate Belonging
Quote: Define yourself radically as one beloved by God. This is the true self. Every other identity is illusion.

Author: Jocelyn Soriano,  Mend My Broken Heart
Quote: Yes, I understand why things had to happen this way. I understand his reason for causing me pain. But mere understanding does not chase away the hurt. It does not call upon the sun when dark clouds have loomed over me. Let the rain come then if it must come! And let it wash away the dust that hurt my eyes!

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: There will always be someone willing to hurt you, put you down, gossip about you, belittle your accomplishments and judge your soul. It is a fact that we all must face. However, if you realize that God is a best friend that stands beside you when others cast stones you will never be afraid, never feel worthless and never feel alone.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: There comes a time in your life when you have to choose to turn the page, write another book or simply close it.

Author: Rumi,  The Essential Rumi
Quote: God turns you from one feeling to another and teaches by means of opposites so that you will have two wings to fly, not one

Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Screwtape Letters
Quote: [God] will not be used as a convenience. Men or nations who think they can revive the Faith in order to make a good society might just as well think they can use the stairs of heaven as a shortcut to the nearest chemist's shop.

Author: Sam Harris,  Letter to a Christian Nation
Quote: I know of no society in human history that ever suffered because its people became too desirous of evidence in support of their core beliefs.

Author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
Quote: Someday, after mastering the winds, the waves, the tides and gravity, we shall harness for God the energies of love, and then, for a second time in the history of the world, man will have discovered fire.

Author: Anne Lamott,  Plan B: Further Thoughts on Faith
Quote: When God is going to do something wonderful, He or She always starts with a hardship; when God is going to do something amazing, He or She starts with an impossibility.

Author: Terry Tempest Williams,  Leap
Quote: This is my living faith, an active faith, a faith of verbs: to question, explore, experiment, experience, walk, run, dance, play, eat, love, learn, dare, taste, touch, smell, listen, speak, write, read, draw, provoke, emote, scream, sin, repent, cry, kneel, pray, bow, rise, stand, look, laugh, cajole, create, confront, confound, walk back, walk forward, circle, hide, and seek.

Author: Patrick Overton,  The leaning tree: [poems]
Quote: When you walk to the edge of all the light you have and take that first step into the darkness of the unknown, you must believe that one of two things will happen. There will be something solid for you to stand upon or you will be taught to fly.

Author: Elisabeth Elliot,  A Chance to Die: The Life and Legacy of Amy Carmichael
Quote: Faith does not eliminate questions. But faith knows where to take them.

Author: Pittacus Lore,  The Power of Six
Quote: Never lose faith in yourself, and never lose hope; remember, even when this world throws its worst and then turns its back, there is still always hope.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: To become one who believes two become one, you need love in your life.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Devil and Miss Prym
Quote: Because you believed I was capable of behaving decently, I did.

Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass
Quote: Sometimes when you lose your way, you find YOURSELF.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: Faith is not something to grasp, it is a state to grow into.

Author: Arnold Bennett
Quote: The chief beauty about timeis that you cannot waste it in advance.The next year, the next day, the next hour are lying ready for you,as perfect, as unspoiled,as if you had never wasted or misapplieda single moment in all your life.You can turn over a new leaf every hourif you choose.

Author: Amy Gatliff
Quote: The greatest act of faith some days is to simply get up and face another day.

Author: Frederick Buechner
Quote: Go where your best prayers take you.

Author: David Platt,  Radical: Taking Back Your Faith from the American Dream
Quote: Radical obedience to Christ is not easy... It's not comfort, not health, not wealth, and not prosperity in this world. Radical obedience to Christ risks losing all these things. But in the end, such risk finds its reward in Christ. And he is more than enough for us.

Author: Thomas Aquinas
Quote: To one who has faith, no explanation is necessary. To one without faith, no explanation is possible.

Author: Elisabeth Elliot,  Through Gates of Splendor
Quote: I have one desire now - to live a life of reckless abandon for the Lord, putting all my energy and strength into it.

Author: T.F. Hodge,  From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph Over Death and Conscious Encounters with "The Divine Presence"
Quote: Head up, heart open. To better days!

Author: أحمد خيري العمري,  إدرينالين
Quote: من قال لك أن درب الجنة معبد بالورود؟

Author: Sam Harris
Quote: We have a choice. We have two options as human beings. We have a choice between conversation and war. That's it. Conversation and violence. And faith is a conversation stopper.

Author: Bernard Branson
Quote: Rejection is an opportunity for your selection.

Author: Ezra Taft Benson
Quote: Men and women who turn their lives over to God will discover that He can make a lot more out of their lives than they can. He can deepen their joys, expand their vision, quicken their minds, strengthen their muscles, lift their spirits, multiply their blessings, increase their opportunities, comfort their soals, and pour out peace.

Author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer,  The Cost of Discipleship
Quote: When all is said and done, the life of faith is nothing if not an unending struggle of the spirit with every available weapon against the flesh.

Author: Kelly Clarkson
Quote: God will never give you anything you can't handle, so don't stress.

Author: Mary Ann Shaffer,  The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society
Quote: Have you ever noticed that when your mind is awakened or drawn to someone new, that person's name suddenly pops up everywhere you go? My friend Sophie calls it coincidence, and Mr. Simpless, my parson friend, calls it Grace. He thinks that if one cares deeply about someone or something new one throws a kind of energy out into the world, and "fruitfulness"is drawn in.

Author: Joel Osteen,  Your Best Life Now: 7 Steps to Living at Your Full Potential
Quote: It's our faith that activates the power of God.

Author: Brené Brown,  The Gifts of Imperfection: Let Go of Who You Think You're Supposed to Be and Embrace Who You Are
Quote: Faith is a place of mystery, where we find the courage to believe in what we cannot see and the strength to let go of our fear of uncertainty.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: The most confused you will ever get is when you try to convince your heart and spirit of something your mind knows is a lie.

Author: Ken Follett,  The Pillars of the Earth
Quote: Having faith in God did not mean sitting back and doing nothing. It meant believing you would find success if you did your best honestly and energetically.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  Mere Christianity
Quote: Faith, in the sense in which I am here using the word, is the art of holding on to things your reason has once accepted, in spite of your changing moods.

Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass
Quote: Realize that if a door closed, it’s because what was behind it wasn’t meant for you.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert
Quote: Faith is belief in what you cannot see or prove or touch. Faith is walking face-first and full-speed into the dark.

Author: Richard Dawkins,  The God Delusion
Quote: Faith can be very very dangerous, and deliberately to implant it into the vulnerable mind of an innocent child is a grievous wrong.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Persistence. Perfection. Patience. Power. Prioritize your passion. It keeps you sane.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Sorrow looks back, Worry looks around, Faith looks up

Author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry
Quote: A bridge of silver wings stretches from the dead ashes of an unforgiving nightmareto the jeweled vision of a life started anew.

Author: Martin Luther
Quote: You have as much laughter as you have faith.

Author: Thomas S. Monson
Quote: When faith replaces doubt, when selfless service eliminates selfish striving, the power of God brings to pass His purposes.

Author: Harper Lee,  Go Set a Watchman
Quote: Prejudice, a dirty word, and faith, a clean one, have something in common: they both begin where reason ends.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: It is difficult to make a man miserable while he feels worthy of himself and claims kindred to the great God who made him.

Author: Corrie ten Boom
Quote: when we are powerless to do a thing, it is a great joy that we can come and step inside the ability of Jesus

Author: John Piper,  Don't Waste Your Life Study Guide
Quote: If you live gladly to make others glad in God, your life will be hard, your risks will be high, and your joy will be full.

Author: Robert M. Pirsig,  Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance: An Inquiry Into Values
Quote: You are never dedicated to something you have complete confidence in. No one is fanatically shouting that the sun is going to rise tomorrow. They know it's going to rise tomorrow. When people are fanatically dedicated to political or religious faiths or any other kinds of dogmas or goals, it's always because these dogmas or goals are in doubt.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi,  The Story of My Experiments With Truth
Quote: When every hope is gone, 'when helpers fail and comforts flee,' I find that help arrives somehow, from I know not where. Supplication, worship, prayer are no superstition; they are acts more real than the acts of eating, drinking, sitting or walking. It is no exaggeration to say that they alone are real, all else is unreal.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Good works is giving to the poor and the helpless, but divine works is showing them their worth to the One who matters.

Author: Anonymous,  The Holy Bible: New American Standard Version [NASB]
Quote: And my God will supply all your needs according to His riches in glory in Christ Jesus.

Author: A.W. Tozer
Quote: Perhaps it takes a purer faith to praise God for unrealized blessings than for those we once enjoyed or those we enjoy now.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: The New King James Version
Quote: And though I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries, and all knowledge; and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, but have not love, I am nothing.

Author: Cara Lockwood,  I Do -- But I Don't
Quote: True love is taking the risk that it won't be a happily-ever-after. True love is joining hands with the man who loves you for who you are, and saying, "I'm not afraid to believe in you.

Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
Quote: There lives more faith in honest doubt, believe me, than in half the creeds.

Author: Jim Valvano
Quote: My father gave me the greatest gift anyone could give another person, he believed in me.

Author: Martin Luther
Quote: I am afraid that the schools will prove the very gates of hell, unless they diligently labor in explaining the Holy Scriptures and engraving them in the heart of the youth.

Author: Jim Butcher,  White Night
Quote: Regardless of what I think about Islam or Wicca or any other religion, the fact is that it's a group of people. Every faith has its ceremonies. And since it's made up of people, every faith also has its assholes.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Witch Of Portobello
Quote: Faith is not Desire. Faith is Will. Desires are things that need to be satisfied, whereas Will is a force. Will changes the space around us,...

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Warrior of the Light
Quote: In order to have faith in his own path, he does not need to prove that someone else's path is wrong.

Author: Aberjhani,  Visions of a Skylark Dressed in Black
Quote: You were born a child of light’s wonderful secret— you return to the beauty you have always been.

Author: Anonymous,  The New Testament
Quote: Beloved, let us love one another, because love is from God; everyone one who loves is born of God and knows God. Whoever does not love does not know God, for God is love.

Author: Timothy Keller
Quote: It is not the strength of your faith but the object of your faith that actually saves you.

Author: Roopleen,  Words to inspire the winner in YOU
Quote: Don’t let mental blocks control you. Set yourself free. Confront your fear and turn the mental blocks into building blocks.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: We live by faith and not by sight.

Author: Sergei Lukyanenko,  Night Watch
Quote: Love is happiness, but only when you believe it will last forever. Even though every time it turns out to be a lie, it’s only faith that gives love its strength and its joy.

Author: Christopher Hitchens,  God Is Not Great: How Religion Poisons Everything
Quote: To 'choose' dogma and faith over doubt and experience is to throw out the ripening vintage and to reach greedily for the Kool-Aid.

Author: A.W. Tozer,  The Knowledge of the Holy
Quote: Any faith that must be supported by the evidence of the senses is not real faith.

Author: Mitch Albom
Quote: You can feel the whole world and still feel lost in it. So many people are in pain-- no matter how smart or accomplished--they cry, they yearn, they hurt. But instead of looking down on things, they look up, which is where I should have been looking, too. Because when the world quiets to the sound of your own breathing, we all want the same things: comfort, love and a peaceful heart.

Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass
Quote: It’s OKAY to be scared. Being scared means you’re about to do something really, really brave.

Author: Lisa Kleypas,  Scandal in Spring
Quote: Most lives are not distinguished by great achievements. They are measured by an infinite number of small ones. Each time you do a kindness for someone or bring a smile to his face, it gives your life meaning. Never doubt your value, little friend. The world would be a dismal place without you in it. (tweaked version of a passage from Scandal in Spring)

Author: يوسف القرضاوي
Quote: ضع في يدي القيد ألهب أضلعيبالسوط ضع عنقي على السكينلن تستطيع حصار فكري ساعةأو محو إيماني و نور يقينيفالنور في قلبي و قلبي في يديربي و ربي ناصري و معنيني

Author: Immanuel Kant,  Critique of Pure Reason
Quote: I had to deny knowledge in order to make room for faith.

Author: Ben Goldacre,  Bad Science
Quote: You cannot reason people out of a position that they did not reason themselves into.

Author: Cheryl Strayed,  Wild: From Lost to Found on the Pacific Crest Trail
Quote: I was a terrible believer in things,but I was also a terrible nonbeliever in things. I was as searching as I was skeptical. I didn't know where to put my faith,or if there was such a place,or even what the word faith meant, in all of it's complexity. Everything seemed to be possibly potent and possibly fake.

Author: Ally Carter,  Don't Judge a Girl by Her Cover
Quote: There are six reasons anyone does anything: Love. Faith. Greed. Boredom. Fear..."he said, ticking them off on his fingers; but he lingered on the last, drawing a deep breath before he said, "Revenge.

Author: Joss Whedon

Author: Jay Leno

Author: A.W. Tozer
Quote: Faith is the gaze of a soul upon a saving God.

Author: Alfred Bester,  The Stars My Destination

Author: Mark Twain,  Pudd'nhead Wilson
Quote: There are those who scoff at the schoolboy, calling him frivolous andshallow: Yet it was the schoolboy who said 'Faith is believing what youknow ain't so'.

Author: Sean Penn
Quote: When everything gets answered, it's fake.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: When someone you love says goodbye you can stare long and hard at the door they closed and forget to see all the doors God has open in front of you.

Author: David Levithan,  The Realm of Possibility
Quote: The word I think of is precarious. I am struck by how precarious it all is. How the things that hold us are only as strong as the faith we have in them.

Author: Matthew Henry,  Matthew Henry's Commentary on the Whole Bible
Quote: Extraordinary afflictions are not always the punishment of extraordinary sins, but sometimes the trial of extraordinary graces.

Author: J.I. Packer,  Knowing God
Quote: Wait on the Lord"is a constant refrain in the Psalms, and it is a necessary word, for God often keeps us waiting. He is not in such a hurry as we are, and it is not his way to give more light on the future than we need for action in the present, or to guide us more than one step at a time. When in doubt, do nothing, but continue to wait on God. When action is needed, light will come.

Author: John Paul Warren
Quote: Let the world know what you live for...not what you fall for!

Author: Brennan Manning,  Abba's Child: The Cry of the Heart for Intimate Belonging
Quote: Our hearts of stone become hearts of flesh when we learn where the outcast weeps.

Author: Joel Osteen
Quote: If you can see the invisible, God will do the impossible.

Author: Maggie Stiefvater,  Forever
Quote: In the darkness, he is invisible, but I can still feel him beside me. Sometimes you don't have to see something to know it is there.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Quote: I am not worried, Harry,"said Dumbledore, his voice a little stronger despite the freezing water. "I am with you.

Author: E.B. White
Quote: Writing is an act of faith, not a trick of grammar.

Author: Hannah Harrington,  Saving June
Quote: It must be comforting, to have a faith like that. To believe so concretely that there’s someone—something— out there watching guard, keeping us safe, testing us only with what we can handle.

Author: Brennan Manning,  Souvenirs of Solitude: Finding Rest in Abba's Embrace

Author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer,  Life Together: The Classic Exploration of Christian Community
Quote: We pray for the big things and forget to give thanks for the ordinary, small (and yet really not small) gifts.

Author: Bob Dylan
Quote: You're gonna have to serve somebody; well, it may be the devil, or it may be the Lord, but you're gonna have to serve somebody...

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Norwegian Wood
Quote: This is one more piece of advice I have for you: don't get impatient. Even if things are so tangled up you can't do anything, don't get desperate or blow a fuse and start yanking on one particular thread before it's ready to come undone. You have to realize it's going to be along process and that you'll work on things slowly, one at a time.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  A Grief Observed
Quote: Talk to me about the truth of religion and I'll listen gladly. Talk to me about the duty of religion and I'll listen submissively. But don't come talking to me about the consolations of religion or I shall suspect that you don't understand.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Faith is an oasis in the heart which will never be reached by the caravan of thinking.

Author: Frederick Buechner
Quote: Doubts are the ants in the pants of faith. They keep it awake and moving.

Author: Brennan Manning,  Abba's Child: The Cry of the Heart for Intimate Belonging

Author: Criss Jami,  Venus in Arms
Quote: Love is as simple as the absence of self given to another. God, when invited, fills the void of any unrequited love; hence loving is how one is drawn closer to God no matter its most horrific repercussions.

Author: Cecelia Ahern,  The Gift

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: New International Version
Quote: And God is able to make all grace abound to you, so that in all things at all times, having all that you need, you will abound in every good work.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  A Grief Observed
Quote: My idea of God is not a divine idea. It has to be shattered time after time. He shatters it Himself.

Author: Emily Giffin,  Love the One You're With
Quote: I think of how life takes unexpected twists and turns, sometimes through sheer happenstance, sometimes through calculated decisions. In the end, it can all be called fate, but to me, it is more a matter of faith.

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: Profound joy of the heart is like a magnet that indicates the path of life.

Author: Joseph B. Wirthlin
Quote: Faith is not so much something we believe; faith is something we live.

Author: Robert G. Ingersoll,  The Works Of Robert G. Ingersoll, Vol. Iii
Quote: Give me the storm and tempest of thought and action, rather than the dead calm of ignorance and faith! Banish me from Eden when you will; but first let me eat of the fruit of the tree of knowledge!

Author: Madeleine L'Engle
Quote: If it can be verified, we don't need faith... Faith is for that which lies on the other side of reason. Faith is what makes life bearable, with all its tragedies and ambiguities and sudden, startling joys.

Author: Leonard Ravenhill
Quote: A man who is intimate with God is not intimidated by man.

Author: Pope John Paul II,  Pope John Paul II: In My Own Words
Quote: I plead with you--never, ever give up on hope, never doubt, never tire, and never become discouraged. Be not afraid.

Author: Nicholas Sparks

Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
Quote: It's faith in something and enthusiasm for something that makes a life worth living.

Author: Augustine of Hippo
Quote: Understanding is the reward of faith. Therefore, seek not to understand that you may believe, but believe that you may understand.

Author: Jenny B. Jones,  There You'll Find Me
Quote: To truly try means to accept God's love, his healing, to accept the world can be ugly, but your heart doesn't have to be. It takes courage, Finley the warrior. "But so is God's love and so are those arms he's holding out for you.

Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge,  The Rime of the Ancient Mariner

Author: Neal A. Maxwell
Quote: Faith in God includes Faith in God's timing.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Small Gods

Author: Tariq Ramadan
Quote: Intellect is a part of a good faith. Intellect is the light, the heart is the direction.

Author: Criss Jami,  Venus in Arms
Quote: Confidence is like a dragon where, for every head cut off, two more heads grow back.

Author: John Bytheway,  When Times Are Tough: 5 Scriptures That Will Help You Get Through Almost Anything

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: After every storm, there is a rainbow. If you have eyes, you will find it. If you have wisdom, you will create it. If you have love for yourself and others, you won’t need it.

Author: Pearl S. Buck

Author: Pope John Paul II
Quote: Faith and Reason are like two wings of the human spirit by which is soars to the truth.

Author: Michael Jackson,  Dancing the Dream
Quote: But for me the sweetest contact with God has no form. I close my eyes, look within, and enter a deep soft silence. The infinity of God's creation embraces me.

Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez,  Of Love and Other Demons
Quote: Disbelief is more resistant than faith because it is sustained by the senses.

Author: سنان أنطون,  يا مريم

Author: Brandon Sanderson,  The Hero of Ages

A loved one recovering from disease, a fortunate business deal, a chance meeting with a long lost friend. It wasn't the grand doctrines or the sweeping ideals that seemed to make believers out of men. It was the simple magic in the world around them.

Author: Aberjhani,  The River of Winged Dreams
Quote: Hearts rebuilt from hope resurrect dreams killed by hate.

Author: J.I. Packer,  Knowing God
Quote: Your faith will not fail while God sustains it; you are not strong enough to fall away while God is resolved to hold you.

Author: Criss Jami,  Venus in Arms
Quote: In order to share one's true brilliance one initially has to risk looking like a fool: genius is like a wheel that spins so fast, it at first glance appears to be sitting still.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Everything Is Illuminated
Quote: I could not believe in a God that would challenge faith like this.

Author: Cristina Marrero
Quote: We never know when our last day on earth will be. So, love with full sincerity, believe with true faith, and hope with all of your might. Better to have lived in truth and discovered life, than to have lived half heartedly and died long before you ever ceased breathing.

Author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett,  Neglected But Undefeated: The Life Of A Boy Who Never Knew A Mother's Love
Quote: Faith is why I'm here today and faith is why I made it through.

Author: Ann Voskamp,  One Thousand Gifts: A Dare to Live Fully Right Where You Are

But a thousand broken and missed things, tens of thousands, lie in the wake of all the rushing.... Through all that haste I thought I was making up time. It turns out I was throwing it away.

Author: Steve Kluger,  My Most Excellent Year
Quote: Never, ever stop believing in magic, no matter how old you get. Because if you keep looking long enough and don't give up, sooner or later you're going to find Mary Poppins.

Author: Jocelyn Soriano,  Mend My Broken Heart

Author: Martin Luther

Author: Jarod Kintz,  American Association for the Advancement of Aardvarks Presents: Dear Natalie

Author: Paul Tillich

Author: Brennan Manning,  Abba's Child: The Cry of the Heart for Intimate Belonging

Author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon
Quote: Care more for a grain of faith than a ton of excitement.

Author: Shannon L. Alder

Author: Randa Abdel-Fattah,  Does My Head Look Big In This?

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  At First Sight

Author: Dallas Willard,  Hearing God: Developing a Conversational Relationship with God

Author: Stanisław Lem

Author: A.W. Tozer

Author: Catherine de Hueck Doherty
Quote: What you do matters — but not much. What you are matters tremendously.

Author: Gregory Peck

Quote: Leap, and the net will appear.

Author: Aberjhani,  The River of Winged Dreams

Author: Abraham Joshua Heschel

Author: Marion Zimmer Bradley,  The Mists of Avalon

Author: Kirsten Miller,  The Eternal Ones
Quote: My faith is big enough to accept all of God's wonders.

Author: Scott Cunningham,  Living Wicca: A Further Guide for the Solitary Practitioner
Quote: We are not on this planet to ask forgiveness of our deities

Author: Meister Eckhart
Quote: I am as sure as I live that nothing is so near to me as God. God is nearer to me than I am to myself; my existence depends on the nearness and the presence of God.

Author: Eugene H. Peterson,  The Jesus Way: A Conversation on the Ways That Jesus Is the Way
Quote: The way of Jesus cannot be imposed or mapped — it requires an active participation in following Jesus as he leads us through sometimes strange and unfamiliar territory, in circumstances that become clear only in the hesitations and questionings, in the pauses and reflections where we engage in prayerful conversation with one another and with him.

Author: Emily Dickinson
Quote: Faith is a fine inventionWhen gentlemen can see,But microscopes are prudentIn an emergency.

Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass
Quote: There’s something really cool about knowing that your destiny is SO big that you’re not meant to share it with anyone. At least not yet.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  The Sandman, Vol. 6: Fables and Reflections
Quote: Of course you don't believe in fairies. You're fifteen. You think I believed in fairies at fifteen? Took me until I was at least a hundred and forty. Hundred and fifty, maybe. Anyway, he wasn't a fairy. He was a librarian. All right?

Author: William Peter Blatty,  The Exorcist
Quote: God never talks. But the devil keeps advertising, Father. The devil does a lot of commercials.

Author: Marty Rubin
Quote: The deep roots never doubt spring will come.

Author: Ray Lamontagne
Quote: And when all your faith is gone let it be me, if it's a friend you need let it be me

Author: Ali Shariati
Quote: My father chose my name , and my last name was chosen by my ancestors . That’s enough, I myself choose my way

Author: Cindy Martinusen Coloma,  Caleb + Kate
Quote: My nature has always been to fight. My faith forces me to forgive.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle,  Walking on Water: Reflections on Faith and Art
Quote: Faith is what makes life bearable, with all its tragedies and ambiguities and sudden, startling joys.

Author: Richard Dawkins,  The Selfish Gene
Quote: The meme for blind faith secures its own perpetuation by the simple unconscious expedient of discouraging rational inquiry.

Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  The Brothers Karamazov
Quote: Believe to the end, even if all men went astray and you were left the only one faithful; bring your offering even then and praise God in your loneliness.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook
Quote: Science only goes so far, then comes God.- Noah Calhoun-

Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass
Quote: There are some places in life where you can only go alone. Embrace the beauty of your solo journey.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: My father taught me that you can you read a hundred books on wisdom and write a hundred books on wisdom, but unless you apply what you learned then its only words on a page. Life is not lived with intentions, but action.

Author: Brennan Manning,  Abba's Child: The Cry of the Heart for Intimate Belonging
Quote: The sorrow of God lies in our fear of Him, our fear of life, and our fear of ourselves. He anguishes over our self-absorption and self-sufficiency... God's sorrow lies in our refusal to approach Him when we sinned and failed.

Author: Evelyn Waugh,  Brideshead Revisited
Quote: I've always been bad. Probably I shall be bad again, punished again. But the worse I am, the more I need God. I can't shut myself out from His mercy. ... Or it may be a private bargain between me and God, that if I give up this one thing I want so much, however bad I am, He won't quite despair of me in the end.

Author: Toba Beta,  My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut
Quote: Love without hope will not survive.Love without faith changes nothing.Love gives power to hope and faith.

Author: A.W. Tozer,  The Knowledge of the Holy
Quote: Faith is an organ of knowledge, and love an organ of experience.

Author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh
Quote: It isn't for the moment you are struck that you need courage, but for that long uphill climb back to sanity and faith and security.

Author: Peter Kreeft,  Pocket Handbook of Christian Apologetics
Quote: If you place [your bet] with God, you lose nothing, even if it turns out that God does not exist. But if you place it against God, and you are wrong and God does exist, you lose everything.

Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass
Quote: The more you go with the flow of life and surrender the outcome to God, and the less you seek constant clarity, the more you will find that fabulous things start to show up in your life.

Author: Jim Butcher,  Death Masks
Quote: I wouldn't burden any decent system of faith by participating in it... I'm not agnostic. Just nonpartisan. Theological Switzerland, that's me.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: God tests, but he does not tempt.

Author: محمد متولي الشعراوي,  كيف تقرأ القرآن الكريم وتحفظه
Quote: القرآن هادي البشرية ومرشدها ونور الحياة ودستورها ، ما من شيء احتاجه البشر إلا بيَّنه اللَّه فيه نصًا أو إشارة أو إيماءً ، عَلِمه مَنْ عَلِمه ، وجهله من جهله

Author: Robert G. Ingersoll,  The Ghosts and Other Lectures
Quote: I will not attack your doctrines nor your creeds if they accord liberty to me. If they hold thought to be dangerous - if they aver that doubt is a crime, then I attack them one and all, because they enslave the minds of men.I attack the monsters, the phantoms of imagination that have ruled the world. I attack slavery. I ask for room -- room for the human mind.

Author: John Ortberg Jr.,  The Me I Want to Be: Becoming God's Best Version of You
Quote: We tend to be preoccupied by our problems when we have a heightened sense of vulnerability and a diminished sense of power. Today, see each problem as an invitation to prayer.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  By the River Piedra I Sat Down and Wept
Quote: God, I am trying to recover my faith. Please don't abandon me in the middle ofthis adventure, I prayed, pushing my fears aside.

Author: John Henry Jowett
Quote: Life without thankfulness is devoid of love and passion. Hope without thankfulness is lacking in fine perception. Faith without thankfulness lacks strength and fortitude. Every virtue divorced from thankfulness is maimed and limps along the spiritual road.

Author: Aberjhani,  Songs from the Black Skylark zPed Music Player
Quote: Oh what a wonderful soul so bright inside you. Got power to heal the sun’s broken heart, power to restore the moon’s vision too.

Author: Jaroslav Pelikan,  The Vindication of Tradition: The 1983 Jefferson Lecture in the Humanities
Quote: Tradition is the living faith of the dead, traditionalism is the dead faith of the living. And, I suppose I should add, it is traditionalism that gives tradition such a bad name.

Author: Jenny B. Jones,  There You'll Find Me
Quote: Does your love reach this far, God? And if it extends to heaven and beyond… why can’t it seem to find me?

Author: نجلاء حسن,  قلب صام عن هوى الرجال
Quote: ولو إستطعت أن أعود بعجلة الزمان إلى الوراء ،لما إخترتك لي عاشقاً !ولأبقيتك عابراً غريباً يزور مدائني دون أن يحدث بداخلي أي ضجيج !

Author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon
Quote: When you see no present advantage, walk by faith and not by sight. Do God the honor to trust Him when it comes to matters of loss for the sake of principle.

Author: James Joyce
Quote: All things are inconstant except the faith in the soul, which changes all things and fills their inconstancy with light.

Author: William Peter Blatty,  The Exorcist
Quote: Perhaps evil is the crucible of goodness... and perhaps even Satan - Satan, in spite of himself - somehow serves to work out the will of God.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Faith is a knowledge within the heart, beyond the reach of proof.

Author: Aberjhani,  The River of Winged Dreams
Quote: Love taught me to die with dignity that I might come forth anew in splendor. Born once of flesh, then again of fire, I was reborn a third time to the sound of my name humming haikus in heaven’s mouth.

Author: Louie Giglio
Quote: But to mean it when I say that I want my life to count for His glory is to drive a stake through the heart of self - a painful and determined dying to me that must be a part of every day I live.

Author: نجلاء حسن,  طرف غترته
Quote: اعذرني !!لن ألوث طهري ونقائي لمجرد إرضائك ،ولن أدنس مبادئي لأكسب شرف قربك مني ..ولن أنزع رداء الطفولة من روحي من ذاتي من وجداني ..لأكون في نظرك أنثى كاملة النضوجهذه أنا إن أردتني بطهري بطفولتي بنقائي بوفائي بعطائي !!وإن لم ترغب بنجلائك كما هي ..إذهب إليهن وغادرنيفكثيرات ياسيدي من هن بحجم رغباتك !وقليلات / قليلات من هن بحجم نقائي !

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: To believe that what has not occurred in history will not occur at all, is to argue disbelief in the dignity of man.

Author: Teresa of Ávila
Quote: The closer one approaches to God, the simpler one becomes.

Author: William Blake
Quote: If the Sun and Moon should ever doubt, they'd immediately go out.

Author: G.K. Chesterton,  Orthodoxy
Quote: They said that I should lose my ideals and begin to believe in the methods of practical politicians. Now, I have not lost my ideals in the least; my faith in fundamentals is exactly what it always was. What I have lost is my childlike faith in practical politics.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Doubt is a question mark; faith is an exclamation point. The most compelling, believable, realistic stories have included them both.

Author: Henry Miller
Quote: Back of every creation, supporting it like an arch, is faith. Enthusiasm is nothing: It comes and goes. But if one believes, then miracles occur.

Author: Kimberly Novosel
Quote: I decided I would fill the emptiness in me with God and with paint.

Author: Max Lucado,  Grace for the Moment: Inspirational Thoughts for Each Day of the Year
Quote: When he says we’re forgiven, let’s unload the guilt. When he says we’re valuable, let’s believe him. . . . When he says we’re provided for, let’s stop worrying. God’s efforts are strongest when our efforts are useless

Author: Tim Minchin
Quote: Science adjusts its views based on what's observedFaith is the denial of observation so that belief can be preserved.

Author: Orson Scott Card,  Sarah
Quote: Faith doesn't mean you never doubt. It only means you never act upon your doubts.

Author: Gordon B. Hinckley
Quote: Our kindness may be the most persuasive argument for that which we believe.

Author: Megan McCafferty,  Bumped
Quote: Faith is accepting what makes no sense, what we cannot prove, but know down deep in our souls is real.

Author: L. Curt Erler
Quote: Today is today, only today... tomorrow...it will only be yesterday.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook
Quote: I have always been a firm believer in God and the power of prayer, though to be honest, my faith has made for alist of questions I definitely want answered after I'm gone.

Author: Christopher Hitchens,  Hitch-22: A Memoir
Quote: Your least favorite virtue, or nominee for the most overrated one? Faith. Closely followed—in view of the overall shortage of time—by patience.

Author: Mitch Albom
Quote: What do people fear most about death? I asked the reb."Fear?"he thought for a moment. 'Well, for one thing, what happens next? Where do we go? Is it what we imagined?"That's big."Yes. But there's something else."What else?He leaned forward."Being forgotten,"he whispered.

Author: William James
Quote: If merely 'feeling good' could decide, drunkenness would be the supremely valid human experience.

Author: Charles C. Ryrie
Quote: The Bible is the greatest of all books; to study it is the noblest of all pursuits; to understand it, the highest of all goals.

Author: R.C. Sproul,  Essential Truths of the Christian Faith
Quote: As the fear of God is the beginning of wisdom, so the denial of God is the height of foolishness.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: At times one remains faithful to a cause only because its opponents do not cease to be insipid.

Author: Abraham Joshua Heschel,  Moral Grandeur and Spiritual Audacity: Essays
Quote: The primary purpose of prayer is not to make requests. The primary purpose is to praise, to sing, to chant. Because the essence of prayer is a song, and man cannot live without a song. Prayer may not save us. But prayer may make us worthy of being saved.

Author: Søren Kierkegaard
Quote: What looks like politics, and imagines itself to be political, will one day unmask itself as a religious movement.

Author: Eric Hoffer
Quote: The opposite of the religious fanatic is not the fanatical atheist but the gentle cynic who cares not whether there is a god or not.

Author: Israelmore Ayivor,  The Great Hand Book of Quotes
Quote: Whatever negative things people think and say about you is enough to bring you down provided you belief that it carries a weight that can push you hard. Don't agree to accept what critics say; be prepared to silence them by doing what they think you can't do!

Author: Oswald Chambers,  My Utmost for His Highest: Selections for the Year
Quote: The life of faith is not a life of mounting up with wings, but a life of walking and not fainting.

Author: Aberjhani,  Elemental: The Power of Illuminated Love
Quote: Everywhere we shine death and life burn into something new…

Author: Nalini Singh,  Visions of Heat
Quote: How do you know it'll be pleasurable?"He got on the bed and lay down.Breath a whisper, she came closer and tied one wrist to the headboard. The cat growled but didn't try to make him wrench free."Because just looking at you gives me the most extreme pleasure I've ever felt.""Christ, baby, tie me up before you start talking like that.

Author: J.S.B. Morse,  Now and at the Hour of Our Death
Quote: A pure heart is superlatively rare and even more attractive.

Author: John F. MacArthur Jr.
Quote: You can’t confuse childlike faith with childish thinking.

Author: Horace
Quote: Pactum serva"- "Keep the faith

Author: Evelyn Waugh,  Brideshead Revisited: The Sacred And Profane Memories Of Captain Charles Ryder
Quote: No one could really hate a saint, could they? They can't really hate God either. When they want to Hate Him and His saints they have to find something like themselves and pretends it's God and hate that.

Author: William Cowper,  The Poetical Works Of William Cowper
Quote: God moves in mysterious waysHis wonders to performs

Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass
Quote: What we are waiting for is not as important as what happens to us while we are waiting. Trust the process.

Author: Søren Kierkegaard
Quote: Faith is the highest passion in a human being. Many in everygeneration may not come that far, but none comes further.

Author: Dan Brown,  Angels & Demons
Quote: Science tells me God must exist.My mind tells me I'll never understand God.My heart tells me I'm not meant to. [Vittoria Vetra]

Author: John Calvin
Quote: It would be the height of absurdity to label ignorance tempered by humility "faith"!(Institutio III.2.3)

Author: Evelyn Underhill
Quote: On every level of life, from housework to heights of prayer, in all judgment and efforts to get things done, hurry and impatience are sure marks of the amateur.

Author: Michael A. Singer,  The Untethered Soul: The Journey Beyond Yourself
Quote: Instead of being encouraged to feel completely protected, loved, honored, and respected by the Divine Force, you've been taught that you're being judged. Because you've been taught that, you feel guilt and fear. But guilt and fear do not open you connection to the Divine; they only serve to close your heart. The reality is that God's way is love, and you can see this for yourself.

Author: Stephen King,  Danse Macabre
Quote: We fall from womb to tomb, from one blackness and toward another, remembering little of the one and knowing nothing of the other ... except through faith.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle,  Walking on Water: Reflections on Faith and Art
Quote: As Emmanuel, Cardinal Suhard says, "To be a witness does not consist in engaging in propaganda, nor even in stirring people up, but in being a living mystery. It means to live in such a way that one's life would not make sense if God did not exist.

Author: Dean Koontz,  The Darkest Evening of the Year
Quote: To many people, free will is a license to rebel not against what is unjust or hard in life but against what is best for them and true.

Author: Gary Parker
Quote: If faith never encounters doubt, if truth never struggles with error, if good never battles evil, how can faith know its own power? In my own pilgrimage, if I had to choose between a faith that has stared doubt in the eye and made it blink, or a naive faith that has never known the firing line of doubt, I will choose the former every time.

Author: Ann Coulter,  Godless: The Church of Liberalism
Quote: No matter what argument you make against evolution, the response is Well, you know, it's possible to believe in evolution and believe in God. Yes, and it's possible to believe in Spiderman and believe in God, but that doesn't prove Spiderman is true.

Author: Solange nicole
Quote: We must be careful more than ever what we let our hearts believe in.

Author: Robert Ferrigno,  Prayers for the Assassin
Quote: The faith is not the problem, Bernadette. The problem is the faithful.

Author: Mother Teresa,  Heart of Joy
Quote: Do we know our poor people? Do we know the poor in our house, in our family? Perhaps they are not hungry for a piece of bread. Perhaps our children, husband, wife, are not hungry, or naked, or dispossessed, but are you sure there is no one there who feels unwanted, deprived of affection?

Author: Robin R. Meyers,  Saving Jesus from the Church: How to Stop Worshiping Christ and Start Following Jesus
Quote: Indeed, a quick glance around this broken world makes it painfully obvious that we don't need more arguments on behalf of God; we need more people who live as if they are in covenant with Unconditional Love, which is our best definition of God. (p. 21)

Author: Jeffrey Lang,  Even Angels Ask: A Journey to Islam in America
Quote: يبدو اننا جميعا بحاجة كي نؤمن بأحد ما أو شيء ما. فالحياة دون معنى او اتجاه بائسة حقا. ويبدوانه يتوجب ان نحيا من اجل هدف او شيء ما عزيز علينا ونموت من اجله، سواء كان هذا الهدف او الشيء مبدأ سياسي او خطة حياتية او أمة اوحلما او فكرة او مالا او اسرة. اعتقد ان التقديس هو جبلة في الانسان، وأن قدرنا هو أن نكون عبيدا سواء شئنا ذلك ام ابينا.

Author: Carl Sagan,  Contact
Quote: If God is omnipotent and omniscient, why didn't he start the universe out in the first place so it would come out the way he wants? Why's he constantly repairing and complaining? No, there's one thing the Bible makes clear: The biblical God is a sloppy manufacturer. He's not good at design, he's not good at execution. He'd be out of business, if there was any competition.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Screwtape Letters
Quote: There is nothing like suspense and anxiety for barricading a human's mind against the Enemy. He wants men to be concerned with what they do; our business is to keep them thinking about what will happen to them.

Author: Bryant McGill,  Voice of Reason
Quote: The greatest joys in life are found not only in what we do and feel, but also in our quiet hopes and labors for others.

Author: Pope Benedict XVI,  The Sacrament Of Charity: Sacramentum Caritatis
Quote: The aim of all Christian education, moreover, is to train the believer in an adult faith that can make him a "new creation", capable of bearing witness in his surroundings to the Christian hope that inspires him.

Author: نجلاء حسن,  قلب صام عن هوى الرجال
Quote: أمقت تلك المسافات التي تفصلني عنك ،أتذمر من تلك المواقيت التي تسرقني منك ..أسخط على أعين تتأملك / على أنامل تلمسكعلى أنفاسك وهي تستنشقك !على نبضاتك وهي تستشعرك ، على ثيابك وهي تعانقك

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced.

Author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett,  Friends 2 Lovers: The Unthinkable
Quote: Faith doesn't get you around problems in life and relationships, it gets you through it.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche,  Twilight of the Idols
Quote: The desire for a strong faith is not the proof of a strong faith, rather the opposite. If one has it one may permit oneself the beautiful luxury of skepticism: one is secure enough, fixed enough for it.

Author: Joseph Smith Jr.
Quote: Let us here observe, that a religion that does not require the sacrifice of all things, never has power sufficient to produce the faith necessary unto life and salvation.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
Quote: عندما يمنحك الله الحياة ، من واجبك (ومن حقك ككائن بشري) أن تجد شيئًا جميلًا فيها ، مهما كان ضئيلًا

Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass
Quote: There is never a moment when God is not in control. Relax! He’s got you covered.

Author: Jon Krakauer,  Under the Banner of Heaven: A Story of Violent Faith
Quote: Common sense is no match for the voice of God.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: For dear me, why abandon a beliefMerely because it ceases to be true

Author: Eugene H. Peterson
Quote: It is not easy to convey a sense of wonder, let alone resurrection wonder, to another. It’s the very nature of wonder to catch us off guard, to circumvent expectations and assumptions. Wonder can’t be packaged, and it can’t be worked up. It requires some sense of being there and some sense of engagement.

Author: Joseph Goebbels
Quote: Faith moves mountains, but only knowledge moves them to the right place...

Author: Liz Curtis Higgs,  Here Burns My Candle
Quote: If the Almighty directs our steps, we've no need to look back over our shoulders.

Author: Margaret Atwood,  The Handmaid's Tale
Quote: Fatigue is here, in my body, in my legs and eyes. That is what gets you in the end. Faith is only a word, embroidered.

Author: Ann Hood,  Comfort: A Journey Through Grief
Quote: Even now, there are still days so beautiful, I almost believe in God.

Author: Toba Beta,  Betelgeuse Incident: Insiden Bait Al-Jauza
Quote: If humor and rumor are needed more than faith and truth, then it tells me something about the kind of world we live today.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Faith and love are apt to be spasmodic in the best minds. Men live the brink of mysteries and harmonies into which they never enter, and with their hands on the door-latch they die outside.

Author: Ernest Holmes
Quote: I live in the faith that there is a Presence and Power greater than I am that nurtures and supports me in ways I could not even imagine. I know that this Presence is All knowing and All Power and is Always right where I am

Author: Yisroel Meir Ha-Cohen
Quote: With faith, there are no questions; without faith, there are no answers.

Author: Cristina Marrero
Quote: Maybe that's why life is so precious. No rewind or fast forward...just patience and faith.

Author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry
Quote: Shine your soul with the same egoless humility as the rainbow and no matter where you go in this world or the next, love will find you, attend you, and bless you.

Author: Yann Martel
Quote: Faith in God is an opening up, a letting go, a deep trust, a free act of love - but sometimes it was so hard to love.

Author: Erin McCarthy,  Hard and Fast
Quote: Honey, nobody ever knows someone completely. You have to just enjoy what you do know and have faith in the rest.

Author: Søren Kierkegaard,  The Sickness Unto Death
Quote: to have faith is precisely to lose one's mind so as to win God.

Author: Eugene H. Peterson
Quote: The Bible makes it clear that every time that there is a story of faith, it is completely original. God's creative genius is endless.

Author: Thaddeus of Vitovnica,  Our Thoughts Determine Our Lives: The Life and Teachings of Elder Thaddeus of Vitovnica
Quote: We have very little faith in the Lord, very little trust. If we trusted the Lord as much as we trust a friend when we ask him to do something for us, neither we as individuals nor our whole country would suffer so much.

Author: Ezra Taft Benson
Quote: While you are going through your trial, you can recall your past victories and count the blessings that you do have with a sure hope of greater ones to allow if you are faithful.

Author: Barry Lyga,  I Hunt Killers
Quote: What was the opposite of linkage blindness? What described being certain of something without any kind of evidence?...The term was faith.

Author: Aberjhani,  The River of Winged Dreams
Quote: Souls reconstructed with faith transform agony into peace.

Author: R.A. Salvatore,  Siege of Darkness
Quote: But what of faith? What of fidelity and loyalty? Complete trust? Faith is not granted by tangible proof. It comes from the heart and the soul. If a person needs proof of god's existence, then the very notion of spirituality is diminished into sensuality and we have reduced what is holy into what is logical.-Drizzt Do'urden

Author: Gail Carson Levine,  Fairest
Quote: Daughter, we didn't need your note - or a prince's visit - to tell us you'd done nothing wrong. We know the daughter we raised. We fear for your future, but never for your character. You take our love and our trust wherever you wander. Father.

Author: William Harwood,  Dictionary of Contemporary Mythology
Quote: The difference between faith and insanity is that faith is the ability to hold firmly to a conclusion that is incompatible with the evidence, whereas insanity is the ability to hold firmly to a conclusion that is incompatible with the evidence.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Last Battle
Quote: Do you think I care if Aslan doomes me to death?” said the King. “That would be nothing, nothing at all. Would it not be better to be dead than to have this horrible fear that Aslan has come and is not like the Aslan we have believed in and longed for? It is as if the sun rose one day and were a black sun.

Author: Thomas Aquinas
Quote: The truth of our faith becomes a matter of ridicule among the infidels if any Catholic, not gifted with the necessary scientific learning, presents as dogma what scientific scrutiny shows to be false.

Author: Karen Marie Moning,  Iced
Quote: You can’t give somebody faith. They either got it or they don’t.

Author: Desmond Tutu
Quote: Out of the cacophony of random suffering and chaos that can mark human life, the life artist sees or creates a symphony of meaning and order. A life of wholeness does not depend on what we experience. Wholeness depends on how we experience our lives.

Author: Kimberly Novosel,  Loved
Quote: I told him I had once lost everything I had, too, and that I think that can be God’s way of building walls around us to force us to look up at Him.

Author: Bill Wilson
Quote: Believe more deeply. Hold your face up to the light,even though for the moment you do not see.

Author: Dan Barker,  Losing Faith in Faith: From Preacher to Atheist
Quote: Faith is a cop-out. If the only way you can accept an assertion is by faith, then you are conceding that it can't be taken on its own merits. It is intellectual bankruptcy.

Author: نجلاء حسن,  قلب صام عن هوى الرجال
Quote: أنا أخبئ بين أقفاص صدري أوجاع نساء الأرض ودموع الصغار ،أنا أحمل على عاتقي خيبات ثكلى !وفي حنجرتي تستقر حشرجة حزن مدوية ..أنا الأنثى التي تقام كل ليلة على مدائن قلبهامآتم الخذلان !وبالرغم من ذلك الأسى المفرط .. .تبتسم وتمضي دونما إكتراث !

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: God is going to send you someone that will rescue you. Then one day you will rescue them in return and together your story will rescue others. He has always been a God of rescues and a maker of warrior’s for his grace. You only need to believe that you are part of something greater than you know.

Author: Dorothy Thompson
Quote: Peace has to be created, in order to be maintained. It is the product of Faith, Strength, Energy, Will, Sympathy, Justice, Imagination, and the triumph of principle. It will never be achieved by passivity and quietism.

Author: Brennan Manning,  Abba's Child: The Cry of the Heart for Intimate Belonging
Quote: For me the most radical demand of Christian faith lies in summoning the courage to say yes to the present risenness of Jesus Christ.

Author: Gordon B. Hinckley
Quote: Our lives are the only meaningful expression of what we believe and in Whom we believe. And the only real wealth, for any of us, lies in our faith.

Author: Mary Doria Russell,  The Sparrow
Quote: I believe in God the way I believe in quarks. People whose business it is to know about quantum physics or religion tell me they have good reason to believe that quarks and God exist. And they tell me that if I wanted to devote my life to learning what they've learned, I'd find quarks and God just like they did.

Author: Joe Kelly,  I Kill Giants
Quote: We're stronger than we think.

Author: Bo Sánchez
Quote: Do not ask directions from the people around you. Ask directions from the person who called you.

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: It is the test of a good religion whether you can joke about it.

Author: Simone Weil,  Gravity and Grace
Quote: He who has not God in himself cannot feel His absence.

Author: Patti Smith,  Just Kids
Quote: We were as Hansel and Gretel and we ventured out into the black forest of the world.

Author: Joyce Meyer
Quote: Fear tries to get us to give up but faith takes us all the way through to victory

Author: Knut Hamsun,  Mysteries
Quote: But what really matters is not what you believe but the faith and conviction with which you believe…

Author: Vladimir Nabokov,  Pale Fire
Quote: All religions are based on obsolete terminology.

Author: John McCain,  Faith of My Fathers: A Family Memoir
Quote: In prison, I fell in love with my country. I had loved her before then, but like most young people, my affection was little more than a simple appreciation for the comforts and privileges most Americans enjoyed and took for granted. It wasn't until I had lost America for a time that I realized how much I loved her.

Author: Thomas Henry Huxley
Quote: What we call rational grounds for our beliefs are often extremely irrational attempts to justify our instincts.

Author: Bree Despain,  The Dark Divine
Quote: God is the ultimate judge of what is truly in our souls. But we are requiered to forgive everyone.

Author: Brigham Young
Quote: I am more afraid that this people have so much confidence in their leaders that they will not inquire for themselves of God whether they are led by him. I am fearful they settle down in a state of blind self security. Let every man and woman know, by the whispering of the Spirit of God to themselves, whether their leaders are walking in the path the Lord dictates, or not.

Author: John Ortberg Jr.,  The Me I Want to Be: Becoming God's Best Version of You
Quote: The goal of prayer is to live all of my life and speak all of my words in the joyful awareness of the presence of God.Prayer becomes real when we grasp the reality and goodness of God's constant presence with 'the real me.' Jesus lived his everyday life in conscious awareness of his Father.

Author: D.L. Moody
Quote: Faith makes all things possible. Love makes them easy.

Author: Eugenia Price
Quote: if someone has just hurt you or broken your heart, if someone has just died, all the grace you need is there-waiting for you to receive it. As long as we are pulled inward-despair and self attention, we aren't free to reach for God's grace. If we mean to leave ourselves alone, we must keep a hand free.

Author: Ray Lamontagne
Quote: But everything I have to give, I'll give to you

Author: Molly Friedenfeld
Quote: Focus on faith and grow your roots strong and deep so no one can make you believe in something that is not good for your soul.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: The whole war between the atheist and the theist comes down to this: the atheist believes a 'what' created the universe; the theist believes a 'who' created the universe.

Author: A.W. Tozer
Quote: When we try to focus our thought upon One who is pure uncreated being we may see nothing at all, for He dwelleth in light that no man can approach unto. Only by faith and love are we able to glimpse Him as He passes by our shelter in the cleft of the rock.

Author: N.T. Wright,  Surprised by Hope: Rethinking Heaven, the Resurrection, and the Mission of the Church
Quote: Logic cannot comprehend love; so much the worse for logic.

Author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Telling
Quote: To learn a belief without the belief is to sing a song without the tune.

Author: Ally Carter,  Don't Judge a Girl by Her Cover
Quote: There are 6 reasons that a person does anything: Love, faith, greed, boredom, fear... revenge.

Author: Jeremy Aldana
Quote: Theology, philosophy, metaphysics, and quantum physics are merely ways for God to have his smart people believe in him

Author: Tom Robbins,  Half Asleep in Frog Pajamas
Quote: Faith is believing in something you know isn't true.

Author: Yevgeny Zamyatin,  We
Quote: knowledge, absolutely sure of its infallibility, is faith

Author: Bahá'u'lláh,  The Kitab-i-Aqdas: The Most Holy Book
Quote: The earth is but one country and mankind its citizens

Author: Umberto Eco,  The Name of the Rose
Quote: The older I grow and the more I abandon myself to God's will, the lessI value intelligence that wants to know and will that wants to do; andas the only element of salvation I recognize faith, which can wait patiently,without asking too many questions.

Author: Lee Strobel,  The Case for the Real Jesus: A Journalist Investigates Current Attacks on the Identity of Christ
Quote: Faith is only as good as the one in whom it's invested.

Author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana
Quote: People will always notice something about you. It might be the way you walk or the way you talk, or just simply your personality. Live each day in the way you want to be remembered. Live in such a way that people will be inspired by those unique qualities that you have and strive to live better lives for themselves.

Author: Paul Torday,  Salmon Fishing In The Yemen
Quote: Faith is the cure that heals all troubles. Without faith there is no hope and no love. Faith comes before hope, and before love. (Sheikh Muhammad ibn Zaidi bani Tihama)

Author: Søren Kierkegaard,  Fear and Trembling
Quote: For he who loves God without faith reflects on himself, while the person who loves God in faith reflects on God.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: New International Version
Quote: Matthew 10:34“Do not suppose that I have come to bring peace to the earth. I did not come to bring peace, but a sword.

Author: Martin Luther
Quote: For all works and things, which are either commanded or forbidden by God and thus have been instituted by the supreme Majesty, are 'musts.' Nevertheless, no one should be dragged to them or away from them by the hair, for I can drive no man to heaven or beat him into it with a club.

Author: Ernest Hemingway,  The Old Man and the Sea
Quote: Have faith in the Yankees my son. Think of the great DiMaggio.

Author: Joyce Meyer
Quote: Sometimes new opportunity means new opposition. Not everything God asks us to do will be comfortable.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  Mere Christianity
Quote: All that we call human history--money, poverty, ambition, war, prostitution, classes, empires, slavery--[is] the long terrible story of man trying to find something other than God which will make him happy.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Everything Is Illuminated
Quote: ...and when is enough proof enough?

Author: Elisabeth Elliot,  A Chance to Die: The Life and Legacy of Amy Carmichael
Quote: We are not asked to SEE,"said Amy. "Why need we when we KNOW?"We know--not the answer to the inevitable Why, but the incontestable fact that it is for the best. "It is an irreparable loss, but is it faith at all if it is 'hard to trust' when things are entirely bewildering?

Author: Maud Hart Lovelace,  Betsy-Tacy and Tib
Quote: In silence the three of them looked at the sunset and thought about God.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: The mystic chords of memory, stretching from every battle-field, and patriot grave, to every living heart and hearth-stone, all over this broad land, will yet swell the chorus of the Union, when again touched, as surely they will be, by the better angels of our nature.--as quoted in THE RIVER OF WINGED DREAMS

Author: Donald Miller,  Blue Like Jazz: Nonreligious Thoughts on Christian Spirituality
Quote: Christian spirituality was not a children's story. It wasn't cute or neat. It was mystical and odd and clean, and it was reaching into dirty. There was wonder in it and enchantment.

Author: Bob Sorge,  Glory: When Heaven Invades Earth
Quote: The nature of the enemy's warfare in your life is to cause you to become discouraged and to cast away your confidence. Not that you would necessarily discard your salvation, but you could give up your hope of God's deliverance. The enemy wants to numb you into a coping kind of Christianity that has given up hope of seeing God's resurrection power.

Author: Kentetsu Takamori
Quote: Living in a world such as this is like dancing on a live volcano.

Author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon
Quote: The Christian should work as if all depended upon him, and pray as if it all depended upon God.

Author: Beth Revis,  A Million Suns
Quote: Elder mocked me for praying once, and i spent an hour berating him for that. He ended up throwing up his hands, laughing, and telling me i could believe whatever i wanted if i was going to hold onto my beliefs so hard.

Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  The Brothers Karamazov
Quote: For if there's no everlasting God, there's no such thing as virtue, and there's no need of it.

Author: Tessa Afshar,  Pearl in the Sand
Quote: I mean that the reason God seems to act in ways that make no sense to us is that our perceptions are wrong. Our expectations are subtly twisted.
